title: 110_s3093
content: The Electronic Employment Verification Reauthorization Act of 2008, also known as the E-Verify Program, permanently extends employment eligibility confirmation pilot programs and requires participation by United States contractors. SEC. 4 amends the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 to require United States contractors entering into contracts with the Federal Government to participate in the E-Verify Program. Section 403(a)(3)(A) of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to include requirements for verifying employment eligibility of existing employees within 10 days of notifying the Secretary of Homeland Security. The Secretary may also mandate employer participation in the verification process. The E-Verify Program may require employers to participate if there are suspicions of violations of immigration laws. SEC. 6. REVERIFICATION. Employers in the E-Verify Program must reverify work authorization within 3 days of expiration. SEC. 7. SMALL BUSINESS DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM. SEC. 7 amends the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act to establish a Small Business Demonstration Program for verifying employment eligibility in rural or small population areas. Section 405 of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to require the Director of USCIS to submit a monthly report to ICE with details of individuals who receive final nonconfirmation through E-Verify, including their name, SSN or alien file number, current employer's information, and any other relevant details determined by the Assistant Secretary. This information can be used by the Secretary of Homeland Security for enforcement purposes. The Director of USCIS may use information provided under subsection (c) to enforce compliance of the immigration laws of the United States.
